intro: Hoehneella santos-nevesii, commonly known as the Santos-Nevessia plant, is a rare and enigmatic species native to the Atlantic Forest of Brazil. It is a small, flowering shrub characterized by its slender stems and clusters of small, white to pale pink flowers. The plant has simple, elliptical leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, contributing to its unique appearance. Hoehneella santos-nevesii is known for its limited distribution and is considered endangered due to habitat loss and fragmentation. Its botanical study is important for understanding the biodiversity of the Atlantic Forest ecosystem.
